definition: reformism (i.e. favoring gradual change as opposed to revolution)
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The dominant hand, Cheng view should be the national capitalists and reformist.
sentences.chinese: 作爲主導面，鄭觀應是民族資本家和改良主義者。

sentences.english: Chenchi was a famous bourgeois reformatory thinker of modern China.
sentences.chinese: 陳熾是中國近代著名的資產階級改良主義思想家。
